subject: Programming
title: Parallel Processing
description: Learn Parallel Processing in one minute.

hook.text: One chef takes an hour to cook dinner. Can four chefs do it in fifteen minutes?

buildup.text: Multi-core processors split work across several cores, each running instructions simultaneously.

discovery.text: Embarrassingly parallel tasks â€” like rendering pixels â€” scale almost perfectly with more cores.

twist.text: Not all tasks can be split. A baby takes nine months no matter how many parents you assign.

climax.text: Amdahl's Law says speedup is limited by the sequential portion. Some work can't be parallelized.

punchline.text: More cores help, but only if the work can be split.

quiz.question: What does Amdahl's Law describe?
options: The cost of adding more memory
